intro: Thapsia minor, commonly known as the lesser thapsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are narrow and aromatic, often with a slight bitter taste. Thapsia minor is typically found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
